title: @Meddler What are the upcoming balance changes to Veigar?
body:
Hi, **Veigar** main here. 

**@Meddler** I wanted to know what ideas you had in mind for the buffs that are coming for Veigar. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Here are some of my thoughts if you want...




**Passive:** I think it's fine no change here.

**Q - Baleful Strike:** I did enjoy what you guys did to his Q during the rework but in-lane trading became difficult albeit stacking has become easier. 

**W -  Dark Matter:** Really nice scaling AoE ability that does well at clearing. I actually max this first against heavy pushers mid. I feel W is in the right place, but it is due to E that it feels a lot weaker.

**E - Event Horizon:** I am not sure how I truly feel about this ability. I miss being able to catch and stun people with accuracy. But the E being delayed actually works very nicely as zoning tool so you can say its better for team fights and tower dives. W is hard to hit when E misses, and with new E it misses a lot by design. 

**R - Primordial Burst:** I really did feel the nerf in dmg after the rework especially w/o dfg. When he is fed and ahead it is very punishing and very toxic ... but then again so is Zed's, Syndra's, Annie's, Talon's, LeBlanc's, Kat's, Yasuo's, etc ultimates. Wouldn't mind some power back here.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Thoughts:**  I think what Veigar needs is more consistency. Sure in the right hands Veigar is a scaling destructive force that almost seems unbeatable at times. But people need to realize that he is weak against all AD mids and suffers in lane due to mana costs, lack of a reliable form of trading, no escapes with no mobility besides using E.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Possible Solutions?**

**E and W Changes:** Make E more reliable at stunning targets. If that's not possible make W easier to land possibly with some form of interaction with E. Possible increasing the AoE of W inside of E.

**Q Changes:** Make his trading more reliable by making Q have diminishing dmg but can pass through multiple monster, minions, and champions or an interesting idea where his Q after passing through/killing the first minion then successfully killing the second minion hit pops Baleful Strike out like MF's Q and prioritizes Champions dealing extra dmg.

_______________________________________________________________________________________
ty4reading
ur boy
barry bordeaux

replies.body:
What we're currently testing: 

* Q grants AP for champion assists as well as kills 
* W starts at the beginning of Veigar's cast time, not the end

These are great changes Meddler! I am a Veigar main, and I'd appreciate these. However, there are a couple other things I think would help Veigar without giving him huge buffs.

1) Increase W range to match maximum E stun range, so I can nuke someone over a wall. Ever since Veigar's changes, E and W have been out of sync.

2) Make E give vision of enemies trapped inside, so I can stun and nuke someone in the fog of war without needing to guess where they are or use a ward.

What do you think of making his E work a bit better to catch people, espcially with mobility but not as broken as before?

What I thought of was something like that the cage has two parts:
Part 1: a "ghost" cage instantly appears that lets people walk through it unpunished but already blocks dashes on contact and then after the delay the "real" cage forms, behaving like before. 
This would help protect Veigar from ganks really well (because a cage that takes that long to set up is too late against fast ganks and gapclosers like Lee Q) but not give him his instastun back.
I like that idea

I'm sure it'll change, but for now... does the W tooltip include the .25s casting time?  Basically, is this going from .25s casting time + 1.2 additional falling time to overlapping, or from 1.2 total to 0.95 total?  My ability to time that in game isn't reliable enough for me to test the current version.
The Fall will begin when you press the button, the cast animation is .3 seconds so the fall should feel more like .9 when it's still 1.2 but just starts faster.

> [{quoted}](name=Kuronan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oWNofOLl,comment-id=0000000d0000,timestamp=2015-09-02T14:52:52.095+0000)
>
> The Fall will begin when you press the button, the cast animation is .3 seconds so the fall should feel more like .9 when it's still 1.2 but just starts faster.

The overall delay is reduced, but the amount of time the enemy has to react is the same basically. Its a big buff against enemies with Tenacity in his E and against immobile Mages.
The main buff is the Q change. Thats a lot if extra AP since Veigar usually only kills 1 enemy per team fight but gets a lot of assists with his E and second targets of his Q.

So you are saying the W will hit the ground sooner? 

I sure hope so, that is the buff he has been needing since the nerf on his E.

what the W change means is that, from the time you press W, it'll still take the 1.2 seconds to come down, but it'll feel like around .9 seconds because of how long the cast time is, overall netting a "Feel" of it falling faster despite the total delay being unchanged.
It does need to fall faster. Even a bronze 5 can easily dodge it since it takes forever to land.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oWNofOLl,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-09-01T07:29:10.141+0000)
>
> What we're currently testing: 
> 
> * Q grants AP for champion assists as well as kills 

That would be a pretty decent-sized buff but a great QoL (I've always hated having to ks for AP), and I'd gladly accept a small ratio nerf for it if veigar were OP after it.

> * W starts at the beginning of Veigar's cast time, not the end

Similar feeling. Any chance of doing this with E, too? It's still the same amount of time for enemies to get off the line when they see the particle, but they have less time to simply walk out of it.
His E is already a .75 second delay starting when you press E rather than the end of the cast time.
no, it's a .5 sec delay total. just checked the wiki
thanks for the correction.

They already did this with E. When they first changed him, they realised the delay was too great, so they made his E start alongside his cast animation. I'm just surprised they only now decided to do it with W.

> [{quoted}](name=Squidblimp,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oWNofOLl,comment-id=000000060000,timestamp=2015-09-01T18:17:26.134+0000)
>
> They already did this with E. When they first changed him, they realised the delay was too great, so they made his E start alongside his cast animation. I'm just surprised they only now decided to do it with W.

:O

I am do double facepalm now.
OMG! I'm main veigar, and I dream with that Q change, because I'd like to use him as supp too!
How I miss doing that since the E change.

I would like to ask you something because it's been quite unclear since the patch 5.5 about Event Horizon

> Event Horizon
> Delay before walls appear decreased to 0.5 from 0.75.
> **Warning particle display now occurs on cast rather than after cast time.**

Does this mean there is 0.25 s cast time with warnings and on top of that 0.5s delay with warnings too? Making that overall a 0.75s warning?
If that is the case, should the tooltip just say 0.75s delay, because the opponent has effectively 0.75s to react?

It means particles show up for .5 seconds, meaning the enemy will know that the horizon is showing up .5 seconds before it actually arrives, which has not changed. It goes from Veigar channeling for .25 seconds, then .5 seconds of particles to warn the enemy to .25 seconds of veigar channeling, while at the same time the particles show up for the .25 seconds of channeling and another .25 seconds after the channel ends

Well I'm not sure, because this is is not really well explained in details in the spell description.
Because technically, the version I had in mind (0.25s cast time with warnings + 0.5s delay with warnings) is still a buff from old version (0.25s cast time without warnings +0.75s delay with warnings) because though the warning duration was the same, the overall time to put the stun was 1 second.
I'm really not sure it's 0.25s cast + 0.25s delay -> 0.5s total delay and warnings to put the stun, because it doesn't feel at all like the total time to put the stun is 2 times faster than the old one. I'm really not sure, that's why I'd like Meddler to confirm. Or anyone else from Riot actually^^ If one goes by and sees this

I read the original threads on this. It isn't 2 times faster. Originally, you'd cast for 0.25 seconds, then there would be the additional 0.5 second warning. Now, the warning appears as soon as you cast, not after, so the only delay is the 0.5 second warning.

What kind of AP gain are we talking about here? Is it going to be the 1-5 AP he gets from killing a champion with his Baneful Strike, or the 2 he gets from last-hitting a Large Monster/Player? Does he need to hit them with Q to get the assist AP bonus or is he going to get the bonus regardless of whether he even casts Q?

This sounds like a nice buff to Veigar to some, but I recognize this is very dangerous to execute because, if done wrong, this could actually be incredibly overpowered but if done right would be a very nice niche and a good incentive to roam/teamfight instead of splitpush/defend to last hit minions.

Of course, all Veigar players would rejoice if W started at the beginning of the cast, gods know Dark Matter is one of the hardest to hit (basic) skills in the game (that I know of anyway)

The Q assist thing would logically be the 1~5 ap from kills he currently gains.

>Of course, all Veigar players would rejoice if W started at the beginning of the cast, gods know Dark Matter is one of the hardest to hit (basic) skills in the game (that I know of anyway)

Also one of the hardest hitting. If the reliability can go up without nerfing the damage, sure. Otherwise I'll question the change...

What's the point of buffing a champion without healthy gameplay? This is exactly like those Tristana buffs before her rework that ended up making her feel gross to play against and her rework had to follow. 

Veigar needs a rework asap, not more ways to stack AP for free to use on his targeted R one-shot.

You know Veigar has been reworked already, right? 

His gameplay health is fine, and he's already lost his identity over improving it once. Let's not change his identity again because players are salty about having to play differently against him. Heaven forbid a champion has the ability to one shot somebody if he lands all of his skills, right?

What is more important, how many times a champion is reworked or League being a fun game for everyone?

His current R will never be okay to exist. I'm okay with the rest of his skills (apart from free infinite AP bonus), because you need to land E to succeed, but his R is just a big no for a game that aims to be fun.

Have you played Veigar? His ult has a very long cool down, is short ranged, and only does single target damage. It is nothing but damage. That's it. No range. No cc. No AOE.

Also, the damage it does is fairly low at early points in the game, and it can only one shot you if you let Veigar become a monster. In my experience, the game needs to run for at least 40 minutes for me to be able to oneshot someone with only my ult, and 50 minutes if that person is the ADC.

I target you and deal damage equal to a Lux ult. It may have short range, big cd and only do single target damage, but is that ability EVER going to feel fair? Like there was some sort of 1v1 outplay the victim could pull off? Don't let a champ get to 650 range of you? Rush Zhonya's and try to activate it the perfect time before his R touches you? No, under no circumstances is this ability acceptable. I'm sorry it's just not how League should work.

The counterplay isn't 1v1ing him, the counterplay is crushing him in lane and then roaming with your advantage, snowballing the game out of control. Veigar is SUPER weak early. He is always OOM until he gets his Chalice, and therefore can't roam for the first 10 or so minutes of the game and do anything effectively. If you shut down his farming and shut him down in lane, he will be behind on AP, and almost all of his damage on his ult comes from AP stacking.

So the counterplay to his ult is strategical, not mechanical.

However, if you are an AP midlaner, you CAN always just Zhonya's his ult... and if you're getting one-shot by his ult as an ADC, well, you fed him super hard, since he has over 1,000 AP if he can do that.

Can you elaborate on if you dislike Veigar's ult in particular or most forms of targeted nuke in general? 

As someone who in most cases dislikes targeted abilities in general, with targeted nukes being the worst case scenarios, I can understand your dislike of having that kind of ability in the game. On the other hand, Veigar sacrifices so much in terms of survivability or any means of a reliable engage/disengage in order to have the kind of reliability that  his ult does. In my experience, Veigar's ult is one of the less frustrating examples of a point and click because of how risky it is to use on a preferred target in a teamfight. If either you or Veigar are roaming and he hits you with it upon meeting each other then I can understand the frustration since there's little way to punish him from getting close to you. In teamfights however, his options for getting to the enemy AP carry (his optimal target) mostly involve landing his stun, having a path made for him by the fighters, or flash ulting and expecting to die.
You are right but you can have a nuke ability that is healthy in all possible scenarios and Primordial Burst definitely isn't one right now.

I was a veigar main in season 4, who quit playing veigar alltogether in season 5. I played in platinum 1/diamond 5 season 5.

The problem of veigar is his E. Q already got buffed, the damage nerf of the ult doesn't matter that much either. His E is what totally destroyed him. Veigar is extremely reliant on landing his E: both early, mid and lategame. In lower elo I guess people still walk into it, in higher elo veigar is unplayable atm. Good midlaners punish veigar for missing his stun, while hitting it is more up to your enemy than up to you. I suggest that the delay becomes shorter (0.25s at most to make it anything reliable/worth playing in higher elo).

I also like to remember you of the reasoning behind changing veigar, which in my opinion still is an incredibly poor argument for changing veigar: Counterplay. Again, I feel like veigar is changed to a low elo champion because his E is unreliable and the reasoning is something lower-elo-players used aswell.

There is plenty of counterplay against veigar. Let me give you some: 
Cleanse - (barely used in soloQ and never used in lower elo. Great counter to veigar. You miss having ignite which makes up for it alot)
Merc treads - Basically means veigar it's harder to hit his W. For tanks/bruisers this means they can kill veigar quite easily because of veigars lack of escapes. VERY hard counter for tanks and bruisers. On most midlaners they are well worth it too. Gives a bit mr too.
Banshees Veil - Great item especially for ADCs. means they can't get stunned and the HP + MR means they can't get oneshot for the biggest part of the game. Most adcs only pick it as 6th item which heavily decreases veigars chances of winning lategame. 
QSS - I prefer Banshees on ADCs, but champions like riven who build QSS can shit on veigar extremely hard. Again, punishes veigar for having only 1 defense ability.
Abyssal sceptre - Magic resistance counter veigar pretty hard because it means he can't get early kills once he hits lvl 6/11. For midlaners like fizz, diana this means they can 1v1 veigar untill he gets alot of stacks. Good players either deny veigar's farm or get fed by killing him. 

The reason I think Veigar has become a low ELO champion is because when I played in season 3 in gold, people barely built above items. In higher elo they do which already means veigar struggles against people who know how to COUNTERPLAY veigar. 

Im extremely pissed for 'ruining' my favorite champion while I think he was extremely balanced; based on whether or not players are willing to sacrifice some items (sorc shoes, etc.) for items that counter veigar in order to win the game. 

I really hope you can make his E so that veigar becomes playable again in higher elo.

Omg! I whait so long for buffs to my main VEIGAR {{champion:45}}  :) and i think this buffs are very nice but i still hate you becouse you nerf his ap ratio on R. You give all ap miders more dmg or attack speed or movement speed when you delete DFG but you nerf veigar i think you can give him 1.1 ap ratio on ulti not 1.0 that will be nice buff or give him passive  on E what give him some % magic penetration like darius E what give him some phisical penetration.
Dude, that horrible to read.... I dont even know if you meant is sarcastic or not...

Good day dear Meddler,

Could you also look into making Veigars Cage a:
**"Cage"** for every champion?
Many Champions like {{champion:105}} {{champion:81}} {{champion:55}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:91}} {{champion:8}} and {{champion:238}} 
can completly ignroe Veigar stun, since they can just jump over it, making his E useless in a fight against these.
The hype is real

I know I'm asking for the moon here, but can you pretty please change veig's Q back to a point and click? I sorely miss the reliability. (the whole reason I loved veig was his super burst and the fact that in a sea of unreliable champs, he was one of the few that could be relied on to be consistent)
Thank you so much for looking at him.  Looking forward to testing out the changes!

Hey @Meddler, I was wondering if you had seen the post I made about making a stacking counter for Veigar a couple of months or so back (link at the bottom)? Would it be possible for that to happen too?

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/6tXAj8Kh-a-veigar-q-stacking-counter

What about the Twitch changes?
EDIT: OK I'M SORRY JEEZ

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=oWNofOLl,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-09-01T07:29:10.141+0000)
>
> What we're currently testing: 
> 
> * Q grants AP for champion assists as well as kills 
> * W starts at the beginning of Veigar's cast time, not the end

And Zyra?

Make his Q point and click so he can become a lane bully again.

every competent veigar player used to play him as a major lane bully and a roamer until his q become a skillshot that anyone at a higher elo can never be hit by if they position properly.

Veigar is not supposed to be a lane bully.

And he shouldn't be.

that means the w will fall .25 seconds faster.

so... cool, i guess?

I feel as if a change from his stun to a slow might suit better given the casting time for his E. A powerful stun? Absolutely. More difficult to capture people? Yea, a bit. Im not one to demand anything, just throwing out an idea to see how others think about it.

as if he needs a buff!! you one shot mages and your skill shot is an aoe thats takes no skill! how more easier do you want him to be? grow some balls and skills and just stop complaining he is already broken enough

well imo veigar doesnt need any buffs 
people will call for buffs till he is op and then cry for nerfs like always...

Jeah, let him be useless in high elo.

Veigar is right now not strong, he is very unreliable.
No Pro team is even considering Veigar as a pick, since he is useless against people who arent Movement cripple and know what to do against him.
Veigar doenst need "more" Damage, he need reliability. His old stun gave him exactly that, now, even if you are VERY good, its doesnt mean you can be a reliable force in the Game.
All what Veigar need this is old "e", don't buff his "q" or "w" (mb "r" need buff) just this stun and he will be fine :) {{summoner:2}} {{champion:45}}
